# Rameswaram–Tirupathi Meenakshi Express__disambig_1

* RMM - MDU : WDG-3A, WDM-3A Locomotive from Diesel Loco Shed, Golden Rock
* MDU - TPTY : WAP-4 Locomotive from Electric Loco Shed, Arakkonam, Erode
| gauge =
| el = 25 kV AC, 50 Hz ( High Voltage Traction)
| trainnumber = 16779/16780
| speed =  average with halts
| sharing = Rameswaram-Kanniyakumari Superfast Express
| maintenance =
|trainlength = 18 Coaches
| owners = Indian Railways
| routenumber = 21/21A
| map =
}}Rameswaram–Tirupati Express connects Holy Island Rameswaram in Tamil Nadu  with Holy City Tirupati in Andhra Pradesh. This train covers a total distance of about . This train is also called as Meenakshi Express as it travels via Temple City of Madurai. The train goes via Madurai, Tiruchchirappalli, Thanjavur, Kumbakonam, Viluppuram, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Katpadi and Pakala. It recently runs with refurbished Utkrist coaches.
Traction
It runs 3 days in a week from Tirupati. It starts on Monday, Friday, Saturday and from Rameswaram it starts from Sunday, Thursday, Friday.
Service
16779 / 16780 runs at average speed of 54 km/h and covers 808 km. It connects some major stations like Ramanathapuram, Madurai, Dindigul, Tiruchchirappalli, Thanjavur, Mayiladuthurai, Villupuram, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Katpadi and Pakala
Rake
This train shares rakes with 22621/22622 Rameswaram–Kanniyakumari Superfast Express
